title: Republican Left (Spain, 1977)
text:
The Republican Left () is a <a href="list%20of%20political%20parties%20in%20Spain">Spanish</a> <a href="republicanism">republican</a> political party. Founded in 1977, it considers itself as the heir to <a href="Manuel%20Aza%C3%B1a">Manuel Azaña</a>'s <a href="Republican%20Left%20%28Spain%29">Republican Left</a>. Its contemporary presence is now limited to a handful of local councillors.
The party describes itself as a republican, <a href="federalism">federal</a>, <a href="Radicalism%20%28historical%29">radical</a>, <a href="secular">secular</a>, <a href="pacifist">pacifist</a> and <a href="environmentalist">environmentalist</a> party. It maintains close links with the <a href="Nonviolent%20Radical%20Party">Nonviolent Radical Party</a>.
Dictator <a href="Francisco%20Franco">Francisco Franco</a>'s death in 1975 allowed for the founding of new political parties. Republican Left was formed in 1977 and in April 1986 became a founding member of the <a href="United%20Left%20%28Spain%29">United Left</a> <a href="electoral%20alliance">electoral alliance</a>, which it broke away from in 2002. It participated in the <a href="Spanish%20general%20election%2C%202004">2004 election</a>, winning 0.07% of the vote. It rejoined United Left in 2011.
